name.description: The name of the block type.

description.description: A brief description of the block type.

ID.description: Defines the ID properties for this block type.

parentsWithout.description: A list of block names that cannot be parents if this block has an ID.

values.description: A list of allowed ID values for this block. If not given, any value is allowed.

asType.description: Specifies if the ID of the block should count as the block type. For example, components have specific definitions based on their ID. This means a script block needs to be defined with the name 'component <componentID>' as well as 'component' to cover all component types available with the 'values' attribute.

shouldHaveParent.description: Indicates if the block should have a parent block.

parents.description: A list of valid parent block types.

needsChildren.description: A list of required child block types.

parameters.description: A list of parameters available for this block type.

#ref.description: A reference to another block parameter.

description.description: A brief description of what the parameter does.

allowedDuplicate.description: Indicates whether the parameter can be duplicated.

canBeEmpty.description: Indicates whether the parameter can be empty.

itemTypes.description: Specifies the type of item the parameter is associated with (e.g., 'vehicle', 'item', etc.). Only for item scripts.
